channel.title: Error Message Creating Fantastical 2.5.1.5 Event
channel.description:
V17.2.5 of Drafts. When i create a brief note in Drafts for Fantastical 2 to parse into an event, e.g., *Take Michele out to dinner tomorrow at 5:30 PM*, I get the following error message:
**There is no application set to open the URL fantastical2://x-callback-url/parse/?sentence=Take%20Michele%20out%20to%20dinner%20tomorrow%20at%205:30%20PM&x-success=drafts5-callback://success/3399A61B-2FA0-4761-899A-E91AF25E3815&x-cancel=drafts5-callback://cancel/3399A61B-2FA0-4761-899A-E91AF25E3815&x-error=drafts5-callback://error/3399A61B-2FA0-4761-899A-E91AF25E3815&x-source=Drafts.**
Anyone know what I'm doing wrong? When I try to tell it to use Fantastical as the app, it shows the app grayed out. If I use options and tell it to show all apps, then select Fantastical, it doesn't work.
Thanks in advance, Bob

item.title: Error Message Creating Fantastical 2.5.1.5 Event
item.dc:creator: ChemBob
item.description:
Yes, it is on a Mac. I forgot that just because it was in the actions list it might not work on the Mac. I’ll try out your link. Thanks!

Bob

Read full topic

item.title: Error Message Creating Fantastical 2.5.1.5 Event
item.dc:creator: agiletortoise
item.description:
This is on a Mac? Fantastical does not support the same URL schemes on their Mac app as their iOS app. There is an updated example action for Fantastical that uses their alternate URL on the Mac, try that one.

Read full topic

item.title: Error Message Creating Fantastical 2.5.1.5 Event
item.dc:creator: ChemBob
item.description:
V17.2.5 of Drafts. When i create a brief note in Drafts for Fantastical 2 to parse into an event, e.g., Take Michele out to dinner tomorrow at 5:30 PM, I get the following error message:

There is no application set to open the URL fantastical2://x-callback-url/parse/?sentence=Take%20Michele%20out%20to%20dinner%20tomorrow%20at%205:30%20PM&x-success=drafts5-callback://success/3399A61B-2FA0-4761-899A-E91AF25E3815&x-cancel=drafts5-callback://cancel/3399A61B-2FA0-4761-899A-E91AF25E3815&x-error=drafts5-callback://error/3399A61B-2FA0-4761-899A-E91AF25E3815&x-source=Drafts.

Anyone know what I’m doing wrong? When I try to tell it to use Fantastical as the app, it shows the app grayed out. If I use options and tell it to show all apps, then select Fantastical, it doesn’t work.

Thanks in advance,
Bob

Read full topic
